title: [279. Perfect Squares](https://leetcode.cn/problems/perfect-squares/)
content:
| English | 简体中文 |
279. Perfect Squares Description Given an integer n, return the least number of perfect square numbers that sum to n.
A perfect square is an integer that is the square of an integer; in other words, it is the product of some integer with itself. For example, 1, 4, 9, and 16 are perfect squares while 3 and 11 are not.
 
Example 1:
Input: n = 12 Output: 3 Explanation: 12 = 4 + 4 + 4. Example 2:
Input: n = 13 Output: 2 Explanation: 13 = 4 + 9.  
Constraints:
1 <= n <= 104 Related Topics Breadth-First Search Math Dynamic Programming Similar Questions Count Primes Ugly Number II Ways to Express an Integer as Sum of Powers
